text: hi everyone Anthony Fantino here the
Internet's busiest music nerd and it's
time for a review of the new weekend
album kiss land the weekend is the
somewhat experimental emotionally
tortured and kind of dark and moody R&B
project of Canadian singer-songwriter
Abel Tesfaye personally I have a bit of
a rocky history with this project
despite Abel's pretty decent falsetto as
well as some rave reviews I firmly
believe that his big breakout project
house of balloons that dropped in 2011
was one of the most unrewarding musical
lessons I had that year the really thin
production on this album ruined it for
me as well as the even thinner lyrical
topics which all kind of seemed like
this desperate attempt to make excessive
partying drug use and sex kind of
introspective meaningful and deep we
have the character that Abel puts
himself in in these weekend songs
indulging in just about everything as
much as he possibly can all the while
kind of painting himself is someone who
is troubled sensitive and incredibly
self-aware of the danger that I guess
he's putting himself in impressively
Abel dropped two more free projects
within a year's time Thursday and echoes
of silence and it was kind of weird
because as people were cooling down on
the project and I can understand why
that was because Thursday was definitely
not as entertaining or as grand or as
ambitious as house of balloons for a lot
of people but but I felt like I was
warming up to what the weekend was doing
especially when echoes of silence drop
the production improved in a big way got
way heavier more lush more vivid the
songwriting felt a lot more
straightforward and to the point a lot
less moments where Abel was kind of just
wandering over these repetitive beats
with his vocals and to me on echoes of
silence his voice sounded way more raw
natural and just human and I think on
that project as well the dark vibe that
Abel had been going for this entire time
really sort of hit home for me it
actually felt real this is the first
project I'd heard from
the weekend that to me was kind of
chilling I understand that dropping
these projects within a year's time
might have been a little bit of over
saturation but I still don't see why
that goes up silence doesn't get as much
props as house of balloons now last year
all of these projects got repackaged and
were commercially sold as a trilogy
which did kind of build the buzz up for
this project again all of the previous
projects to drop from the weekend did
get cleaned up a little bit sonically
and in my opinion even though I didn't
really love house of balloons once this
remaster came through I did like the
sound a lot more so having heard these
better sounds on this trilogy enjoying
echoes of silence I was legitimately
looking forward to whatever the weekend
was gonna do next but then the single
the lead single the title track for this
album dropped in in my heart just sank
the instrumental on this track was just
glistening not as much darkness or edge
in my opinion as some of the previous
beats to drop from the weekend though I
still think the atmosphere on this track
was huge the bass and the drums were
slow heavy kind of crushing but I think
the most disappointing thing about it
were Able's vocals his his singing and
his lyrics on this song really the
entire track felt like a rehash of
everything he had been doing for the
past three weekend projects not only
that but it felt like Abel was backing
away from writing those more
straightforward songs and was getting
back into that habit of just merely
finding a beat
finding a groove just repeating it over
and over and then aimlessly singing your
story over it in a really badly paced
way
unfortunately this really redundant
songwriting style is exactly what Abel
serves up for every single track on kiss
land the production is still large is
still atmospheric in a way kind of
cinematic but what always ends up
disappointing like I said earlier it's
the pacing take the song adaptation for
example it's just four minutes and 44
seconds but it feels like it goes on
forever
it's just got this really large slow
lumbering beat that just repeats repeats
and repeats and there's not much
changing up on this song there's not
much progression or alteration outside
the story that Abel is trying to tell in
his lyrics and if you dive into the
lyrics like adapted to the models who
adapted to the bottle they take it down
like water just to burn away their
sorrows it's clear that Abel is not
changing his lyrical game up on this LP
after listening to this album I'm
absolutely convinced that the weekend is
not as lyrical as some people make him
out to be his stories are not as detail
there is fleshed out or as meaningful as
people believe they are and in my
opinion taking these themes and in
trying to make them really sad trying to
make them really emotional to me just
feels like throwing lipstick on a pig
and those lyrics I just mentioned are
from from a chorus where you have all
these vocals stacked on top of one
another something I think was placed
into the track to kind of break up the
monotony of the instrumental and Abel's
voice but whenever that attempt is made
it usually kind of comes out sounding
ridiculous or just not that interesting
the chorus on the song professional 2 is
incredibly underwhelming and almost
pointless and a non chorus I think the
most notable change in pace on this
entire album came on the song live for
where I never looked more forward to a
Drake verse in my entire life though the
song wanderlust has kind of changed
gears for the album it's it's this weird
synth funk track with this upbeat funky
groove that feels kind of Rick James
inspired but still even this track
doesn't develop that far past the funky
groove it establishes at the beginning
and once again were delivered another
monotonous song just this time it's got
kind of a catchy groove but I think
maybe part of the issue with the weekend
not only his songwriting style which
does get kind of repetitive but the
instrumentals on this track - which just
don't show that much variation and a lot
of the very very cloudy and Atmospheric
sense surrounding these tracks kind of
take away the body of the songs and
probably give them less character in the
long run because toward the end of this
album Pharrell Williams actually has a
remix of this song and it is way more
enjoyable mostly because these scents
are Way punchier and the
instrumental itself is is just a lot
more colorful a little fruitier if you
want to say that and you know what the
thing is even though the instrumentation
feels a little more upbeat I feel like
that inherent sadness and just that
melancholy the weekend brings to the
table it's it's still there overall I
feel like able kind of went easy on us
with this album by not delivering any
stories that that felt fresh or new or
bold for the weekend for not bringing
any instrumentals to the table that had
any true character outside of their
overuse of reverb and their really
really slow pace there are even moments
where I feel like Abel's vocals are a
little bit more subtle dainty and just
kind of understated than his vocals in
the past even the last track on this
album there are some effects on his
vocals that kind of obscure his voice
and make it difficult to even make out
what he's saying and if the weekend has
been consistent with anything up to this
point it has been having intelligible
lyrics while I think the weekend still
has some potential to come through with
something interesting in the future and
and still has a defined sound in the R&B
world when you hear a weekend song you
know it's weekend song but overall this
project just feels like a rehash of a
lot of moments from the weekends
previous stuff but done in a slightly
less interesting way while this record
wasn't terrible to me it wasn't you know
the worst thing in the world there were
some good points but the good points
that I heard here I've already really
heard from from this project I'm feeling
a light five on this thing honestly
transition but if you've given this
weekend album a listen what did you
think of it did you love it hate it why
what do you think I should review next
and that's it Anthony Fantana weekend
kiss land forever
